entry.title: Re: How to find an unique (distinct) value from incoming...
entry.content:
In SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI), sometimes you get payloads (like XML or JSON) with duplicate values, and you want to filter out only the unique/distinct ones. There are a few approaches depending on your payload type and requirement:

🔹 1. Using Content Modifier + Groovy Script

If your payload is XML/JSON and you need to extract distinct values, Groovy is the most flexible way.

Example (XML Payload):

<Root>
<Order>
<ProductID>101</ProductID>
</Order>
<Order>
<ProductID>102</ProductID>
</Order>
<Order>
<ProductID>101</ProductID>
</Order>
</Root>


You want the unique ProductID values → 101, 102.

Groovy Script Example:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import groovy.xml.*

Message processData(Message message) {
def body = message.getBody(String)
def xml = new XmlSlurper().parseText(body)

// Collect distinct ProductIDs
def uniqueProducts = xml.Order.ProductID*.text().unique()

// Convert back to XML or String
def result = "<UniqueProducts>" + uniqueProducts.collect { "<ProductID>${it}</ProductID>" }.join('') + "</UniqueProducts>"

message.setBody(result)
return message
}


Output:

<UniqueProducts>
<ProductID>101</ProductID>
<ProductID>102</ProductID>
</UniqueProducts>

🔹 2. Using Message Mapping with UDF

If you’re using message mapping, you can write a User-Defined Function (UDF) in Java to eliminate duplicates.

Example UDF:

import java.util.HashSet;

public void removeDuplicates(String[] input, ResultList result) {
HashSet<String> uniqueSet = new HashSet<>();
for(String val : input) {
if(uniqueSet.add(val)) {
result.addValue(val);
}
}
}


You can then map this UDF to your target node to ensure only distinct values are passed.

🔹 3. Using JSON to XML Converter + Script

If the incoming payload is JSON, convert it to XML using the JSON to XML Converter step, then use the Groovy method above to filter duplicates.

🔹 4. Using Aggregator Pattern (if needed)

In some scenarios, you may receive multiple messages with repeated values. You can use the Aggregator step in SAP CPI to collect values and then apply distinct logic via script.

✅ Best Approach:

For XML payload → Groovy with XmlSlurper or message mapping UDF.

For JSON payload → Convert to XML, then apply script.

For real-time filtering → Script is the most flexible and powerful option.

entry.title: Don't Let Storage Limits Cloud Your Vision How to Keep SAP Signavio Process Insights Working for You
entry.content:
At some point, every growing team hits a wall.

Reports slow down, dashboards need to be exported manually, and storage warnings pop up more often. This is not a system failure; it's a sign that you're doing something right.

If you're experiencing all this in your use of SAP Signavio Process Insights, it's because you've built something successful enough that it’s outgrowing its limits. Yet, when you hit those storage limits, the clarity that once guided your decisions starts to dim, just when you need it most. 

The good news is that you can scale your business process management capabilities without starting over.

 

When Growth Creates Friction

SAP Signavio Process Insights was built to light up your business process landscape. As your organization evolves, that spotlight needs room to expand. That's where record-based entitlements come in.

 Instead of managing storage thresholds, our new model gives you the flexibility to focus on insights, not capacity. There is no commercial friction, no technical rework, and just uninterrupted visibility into what's working, what's lagging, and where to go next.

 

Are You at a Turning Point?

You might be ready to move to a record-based model if:

  • You're above 90% storage capacity
  • You're manually exporting reports to stay under the limit
  • You're planning to scale Process Insights across more teams or processes

If any of these situations sound familiar, now's the moment to future-proof your setup and maintain momentum without delays.

 

Keep the Light On — and the Insights Flowing

We've put together a short, practical guide to help you make the shift with confidence: 

👉Download the guide

 

What About You?

Have you faced this challenge in your organization? Are you already working with record-based entitlements or navigating that shift now?

Share your experience in the comments below or start a thread in the SAP Signavio Community. Let's learn from each other and build momentum together.

entry.title: Re: Print 8D Report from Q2 Quality Notification
entry.content:
How you have entered the values? While =immediate Tasks and Activities are typically entered at the header level, Corrective Tasks, Causes, and Comments are entered at the item level. If these are entered in a wrong place, then, system wont fetch to report.

Have you maintained the sort sequences and codes ? SAP uses sort sequences and codes to structure the 8D report and if you have maintained in Notification Type (Q2), then the report will not show the desired values.

Also, it seems, Function Module QM06_FM_TASK_REQUEST_8DREPORT to be activated in the Action Box configuration for Q2 notifications as per SAP note 1073905

entry.title: Re: FIORI Elements - Button with navigation to DataPage (...
entry.content:
The difference is followig, in V2 is the section Routing empty, looks like this

"routing": {
      "config": {},
      "routes": [],
      "targets": {}
    }

and the navigation is defined in section sap.ui.generic.app (you can see it in screenshot of Manifest V2).

In Manfest V4 the navgation is defined with Routing (see screenshot Manifest V4) and there is no Section sap.ui.generic.app.

entry.title: Re: Getting error while using this ODATA API to create bi...
entry.content:
Hi @anijaambika,
 
The error "Billing of BDR 100000314 NOT SUPPORTED BECAUSE ITS SD DOCUMENT CATEGORY IS PBRQ" means that the Billing Document Request (BDR) you are trying to bill has an SD Document Category PBRQ, which is not supported for billing with the CreateFromSDDocument API. 

Why this happens: 

  • The API expects the input document to be of a billable SD Document category (like sales orders, contracts). 
  • PBRQ stands for a Billing Request document category, which is a preliminary request, not directly billable. 

What to do: 

  • You cannot create a billing document directly from a BDR with category PBRQ. 
  • You need to first process or convert the Billing Document Request into a billable SD document (such as an order or contract) supported by the billing process. 
  • Then use that SD document number in the API call. 
     

Summary: 

Billing from BDR with category PBRQ is not supported. Use a billable SD document instead. 

If you need help with converting BDR to a billable document, please check your business process or contact your SAP consultant. 

Thanks and best regards,
Anushka

entry.title: Re: Reference information in MT940 tag :61:
entry.content:
Hello @Vittorio1 

Thank you for your question.

Based on the issue you face from MT940 files into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, specifically regarding the scenario you highlighted with parsing references from tags :61: and :86:, here are a few facts.

Your current issue:

  • Your parser for the :61: tag stops reading at the // delimiter. This means that, in the example, NONREF is extracted and anything after // (specifically the 103814) is ignored by standard rules.
  • Separately, in the :86: tag, the reference (e.g., MX-103814-TRE100180) appears after position 50. The SAP delivered reprocessing rules only evaluate the first 50 characters in this tag, so references appearing deeper in the string are not mapped.

Here are some standard Tools to consider:

  • You can use the Manage Bank Statement Reprocessing Rules app to build mappings if the reference always appears within a predictable substring in tag :61: or in the first 50 chars of tag :86:.
  • For this scenario, since the reference appears after // in :61: or deep into :86:, the standard rules are not sufficient.

SAP Public Cloud Extensibility:

  • The official way recommended by SAP for complex parsing or mapping needs is to use in-app extensibility, specifically the Custom Logic app for the Bank Statement Item Processing business context.
  • This lets you create a BAdI, an Enhancement Implementation which allows you to:
    • Parse the tag :61: string after the // delimiter and extract 103814 or any similar reference.
    • Parse tag :86: and search for references regardless of character position, thus circumventing the 50-character limitation.
    • Assign the extracted reference dynamically to a field such as Assignment for use in matching and reconciliation.

Below are some recommendations you should consider:

  • If the reference position is always fixed and within the supported range of first 50 chars, reprocessing rules can map the value.
  • For cases like this where the reference appears deeper or in multiple places, you can proceed with developing a Custom Logic enhancement.
  • The enhancement should scan :61: and :86: for known patterns, extract the operation reference, and place it in ZUONR for subsequent SAP processing.

Consider the references below for further details.

    • Reprocessing Bank Statement Items (Public Cloud)
    • Extensibility: Bank Statement Processing (Public Cloud)
  • For business context: use “FI_BANK_STATEMENT_ITEM” and BAdI “Enhance Processing of Bank Statement Items.”

To summarise, the best route in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is a Custom Logic enhancement for bank statement processing, to handle dynamic parsing and populate the correct reference fields for reconciliation. Please let me know if you need technical details or example code for this enhancement.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Multiple Delta Accrual on the Same Date
entry.content:
We have a condition contract that has a validity of 1 Jan 2025 to 30 June 2025. A delta accrual was executed on the 30th June 2025 and posted correctly.

 However, we have discovered that there are some billing documents that had not been posted and these documents have a billing date of 30 June 2025. Since we had executed the delta accrual for this date we can’t run another delta accrual for the same date.

 My question is what is the process to get the “outstanding” billing documents included in the accrual?

entry.title: Sync the rating from the goal to the performance form
entry.content:
Hello, 

we have a performance form with autosync from goal plan. 

In the goal plan we have set custom calculation for rating field as shown below: 

<calculator id="RatingRule1"><![CDATA[tipeobj=="binario" && migliora_se=="aumenta" && actual_achievement>=tgt]]></calculator>

  <calculator id="RatingCalculation1"><![CDATA[100]]></calculator>

  <calculator id="RatingRule2"><![CDATA[tipeobj=="binario" && migliora_se=="diminuisce" && actual_achievement<=tgt]]></calculator>

  <calculator id="RatingCalculation2"><![CDATA[100]]></calculator>

<auto-population field="rating" mode="auto" calc-type="col">

    <rule>

     <rule-condition calculator-id= "RatingRule1"/>

     <calculated-result calculator-id= "RatingCalculation1"/>

    </rule>

    <rule>

     <rule-condition calculator-id= "RatingRule2"/>

     <calculated-result calculator-id= "RatingCalculation2"/>

    </rule>

ecc...

All the goal information added from the Goal module is synced and the rating is visible on the Performance form. However, the rating on the Performance form is not populated:

 

Could you please help me to undestand why this happening?

Thank you

Regards

 

SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals

entry.title: Re: EML : Business Object Interface Exception Handling
entry.content:
Hello @adnanmaqbool 

Thank you for your questions and for sharing the screenshot.

It was very helpful. Here’s an easy method to read RAP EML messages in S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment and map them to your items.

1) Interaction-phase messages (RE

DATA lt_texts TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.

 

LOOP AT reported-productionorder INTO DATA(ls_rep).          "entity-specific table

  LOOP AT ls_rep-%msg INTO DATA(lo_msg).                     "if_abap_behv_message

    APPEND lo_msg->get_text( ) TO lt_texts.                  "plain text

  ENDLOOP.

ENDLOOP.

2) Save/commit messages (REPORTED in COMMIT ENTITIES)

COMMIT ENTITIES BEGIN

  RESPONSES

    FAILED   DATA(failed_commit)

    REPORTED DATA(reported_commit).

"...

COMMIT ENTITIES END.

 

LOOP AT reported_commit-productionorder INTO DATA(ls_rep_c).

  LOOP AT ls_rep_c-%msg INTO DATA(lo_msg_c).

    APPEND lo_msg_c->get_text( ) TO lt_texts.

  ENDLOOP.

ENDLOOP.

3) Which rows failed (FAILED)

IF failed-productionorder IS NOT INITIAL.

  LOOP AT failed-productionorder INTO DATA(ls_failed).

    " correlate via ls_failed-%cid / %key to your input

  ENDLOOP.

ENDIF.

IF failed-productionorder IS NOT INITIAL.

  LOOP AT failed-productionorder INTO DATA(ls_failed).

    " correlate via ls_failed-%cid / %key to your input

  ENDLOOP.

ENDIF.

IF failed-productionorder IS NOT INITIAL.

  LOOP AT failed-productionorder INTO DATA(ls_failed).

    " correlate via ls_failed-%cid / %key to your input

  ENDLOOP.

ENDIF.

 

4) Optional: get T100 ID/number (if available)

TRY.

    DATA(lo_t100) = CAST if_t100_message( lo_msg ).

    DATA(lv_id) = lo_t100->t100key-msgid.

    DATA(lv_no) = lo_t100->t100key-msgno.

  CATCH cx_sy_move_cast_error.

ENDTRY.

5) Map created keys (MAPPED → final key)

IF mapped-productionorder IS NOT INITIAL.

  DATA(ls_finalkey) = VALUE i_productionordertp_key( ).

  CONVERT KEY OF i_productionordertp

    FROM TEMPORARY VALUE #(

      %pid = mapped-productionorder[ 1 ]-%pid

      %tmp = mapped-productionorder[ 1 ]-%key )

    TO FINAL(ls_finalkey).

  "ls_finalkey-productionorder = created number

ENDIF.

Notes
• %msg exists per reported row; at compile time you access reported-<entity> (no RTTI needed).
• Capture both phases: before COMMIT ENTITIES and inside it.
• Use %cid/%key to tie messages to your input rows.

If you want, I can wrap this into a tiny reusable utility example zcl_eml_msg=>collect( reported )) that returns a bapiret2 table

You can check below SAP Useful References(GenAI Assist support)

  • ABAP Help: Entity Manipulation Language (EML) – response params FAILED/MAPPED/REPORTED. SAP Help Portal-Entity Manipulation Language (EML)
  • ABAP Help: COMMIT ENTITIES – persist buffer and capture commit-phase messages. SAP Help Portal-COMMIT ENTITIES
  • ABAP Help: Responses structure per entity. SAP Help Portal-<method> FOR MODIFY
  • ABAP Help: IF_T100_MESSAGE (retrieve T100 ID/number). SAP Help Portal-Messages - IF_T100_MESSAGE in a Regular Class
  • ABAP Help / Docs: CONVERT KEY (late numbering → final keys). SAP Help Portal-Using Keys and Identifying RAP BO Instances in a Nutshelleduardocopat.github.io

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: How to find the correct Redirect URI for Social Login with SAP CDC APIs (no Screen-Sets)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m working on a project where we need to configure Social Login in SAP Customer Data Cloud. The social providers (Google, Facebook, Apple, etc.) all require us to register a Redirect URI.

My doubts are:

  • Where do I find the correct Redirect URI in SAP CDC?
  • Does the Redirect URI change depending on the social provider?
  • The CDC APIs (for example accounts.socialLogin) also expect a redirect_uri parameter — what exactly should I provide here? 

Important note:

  • I am not using Screen-Sets, only the APIs, because the login has to be exposed to a mobile app.
  • Once configured, how can I test the integration with Postman (e.g. simulate the redirect flow and exchange the code with CDC)?

Thanks in advance!

Stefania

entry.title: Re: S_ALR_87013558 report (how to execute in background)
entry.content:
hi, got to table TKEB1, and fill in the keys which comes from txn which has transaction START_REPORT under the attribute D_SREPOVARI-EXTDREPORT.

for eg. Tcode : S_ALR_87013558, 

attribute D_SREPOVARI-EXTDREPORT has value KP 01RPSCO_X 12KST1A, which holds the value of primary keys to table TKEB1

Field RNAME from table TKEB1 have the report name(GP4QMGQLJUU82ONXIDTZ01D6JOO) which can be executed with option of background mode.

Regards,

Dharmendra Kumar

entry.title: Odata metadata error : Model 'ZGW_XXX_MDL_0001_BE' contains errors. Contact Adminstrator
entry.content:
We are experiencing a failure in metadata calls from the application in our environment. The issue is impacting the functionality of OData services and causing delays in data retrieval.

Steps Taken:

  1. Cleared Gateway (GW) cache,
  2. Checked the Service maint configuration.
  3. All network and connection are good.

error: Model 'ZGW_SMS_MDL_0001_BE' contains errors. Contact Adminstrator

error id:  /IWFND/MED039

url: /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGW_XXX_SRV/$metadata

We request assistance in analyzing the root cause of the metadata call failure. Please advise on:

  • Any known issues or patches related to metadata failures.
  • Recommended steps to debug or resolve the issue.
  • Whether additional Gateway or backend configurations need to be reviewed.

entry.title: Re: SPOT awards - Data anonymization
entry.content:
In our test environment, we mask sensitive employee data, including compensation and bonuses; through data imports. For bonuses, we use the PayComponentNonRecurringImportTemplate available on the Import Employee Data screen.

To streamline this process, a report was created that contains all the necessary template fields for masking bonus data after each environment refresh. Before granting access to others, we ensure that all personally identifiable information (PII) is masked, including: Address, Email, Compensation, Bonus, Date of Birth, Phone Number, etc.

entry.title: Re: How to add a field documentation in a custom analytic...
entry.content:
Hello @Chris101 

Thank you for your question and the screenshot.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the multidimensional report that opens from Custom Analytical Queries doesn’t display @EndUserText.quickInfo in the More Field Help popover. For many custom or calculated fields, you’ll simply see “No Help Available.” The content of that popover depends on the report viewer, not just your CDS annotations. SAP Learning-Working with Multidimensional Reports    SAP Help Portal-EndUserText

What  you should do

  • Put guidance in the query header: add your explanation in Custom Analytical Queries → Query Information → Description so users see it in the report header. SAP Help Portal-EndUserText
  • Use a UI that supports tooltips if you need per-field help:
    • Fiori elements can surface quick info/tooltips via annotations (e.g., @Common.QuickInfo). GitHub
    • In SAP Analytics Cloud, you can add tooltip measures/dimensions on charts/tables. SAP Help Portal-Select Accounts, Measures, and Dimensions
    • SAPUI5 generally treats tooltips as UI-specific; not every control shows them. sapui5.hana.ondemand.com-Discover New Enterprise Grade Horizons

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Newly registered user has old activities
entry.content:
Hello Team!

 

We have noticed that a newly registered user has activities starting from years ago.

Can you please explain this behavior and help us how to get rid off them?

 Thank you


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Newly registered user has old activities
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Activities before the registration data were imported by one of your source connectors.

Only you can know which connector imported those activities.

Old activities can be deleted by Data Retention.

Please note that min Retention Period is 14 days, which means if you set up the correct roles the old activities will be deleted after 14 days.

 

Best Regards,

Tamas

entry.title: Sort order of segments in IDOC_DATA_INSERT
entry.content:
This post refers to an ERP 750 system.

I passed several custom segments of different types to the caller of the BADI. Unfortunately they have not been considered. Debugging the standard code, I found out, that the lines have to be of a certain sort order which has to be coherent to the order, in which the segment types appear in the IDOC definition. This coding can be found in LEDI1F09:

* jetzt sind in i_edid4 die zusätzlichen Segmente eingemischt
* die Segmentnummern sind nicht fortlaufend!! - nur die eingemischten
* haben nach der neuen Zählung die richtigen Nummern
* die Hierarchiefelder sind bei den neuen nicht gefüllt
* syntaxprüfung
    perform fa5_syntax_after_insert using i_edidc ident rc.
    if rc eq 0. " dann können die Änderungen abgespeichert und die
                " statussätze entsprechend geschrieben werden
                " vorher nachsehen, ob die Statussätze aus dem vorigen
                " BADI nachträglich geändert werden müssen

So I created a sorter routine that puts the lines in the right order (using the field COUNTER to influence on the order):

    class-methods sort
      importing
        control       type edidc
        input         type tab_idocins
      returning
        value(result) type tab_idocins.

(...)
method sort.
    " for use in implementations of BADI IDOC_DATA_INSERT:
    " make sure the inserted segments come with the same order as
    " in the syntax of the IDOC. Otherwise, they will be
    " rejected by the BADI afterwards
    data count type n length 3.
    call function 'EDI_IDOC_SYNTAX_GET'
      exporting
        pi_idoctyp       = control-idoctp
        pi_cimtyp        = control-cimtyp
      tables
        pt_syntax_table  = syntax_lines
      exceptions
        syntax_not_found = 1                " No entry in EDISYN found
        others           = 2.
    if sy-subrc <> 0.
      result = input.
      return.
    endif.
endmethod.
    sort syntax_lines ascending by parseg nr.
    loop at syntax_lines into data(line).
      loop at input into data(input_line) where segnam = line-segtyp.
        add 1 to count.
        insert value #(
          base input_line
          counter = count
          ) into table result.
      endloop.
    endloop.

In my BADI implementation, I call this method at the end of the implementation of:

  method if_ex_idoc_data_insert~fill.
(...)
      data(entries) = zcl_tool_idoc_segment_sort=>do(
        input = create_entries( )
        control = control ).
     insert lines of entries into table new_entries.
  endmethod.

Maybe I've overseen some standard way to deal with this problem. If so, I would be grateful to know about it.

entry.title: Redeployment of Landing Pages to migrate from Neo to the Cloud Foundry platform
entry.content:
Call to action:

For the migration in the productive system, you must adjust the CDN accordingly and redeploy the existing landing pages and forms. Else those landing pages and form will not work anymore after 2025-12-31.

 

Motivation: 

In SAP Marketing Cloud Customers can use forms and landing pages to collect customer data or trigger registration processes. This functionality will be migrated in the SAP context of migrating Neo scenarios to Cloud Foundry.   

Why are we migrating? 

The multi-cloud foundation has become the strategic focus for SAP BTP because of its significant benefits as compared with the Neo environment, including its principles of openness and freedom of choice in terms of support for multiple infrastructure providers, data centers, and a wide range of runtimes and programming languages. For Neo you can use selected services only and therefore the scenarios on Neo must be migrated to the multi-cloud foundation. Explanation in SAP Help Portal of the migration.

 

Are you affected? 

If you are not using landing pages or forms you do not need to do anything.  If you are using landing pages or forms and you have not republished the landing pages/forms since January 1st, 2022 you are affected.

What you you need to do?

Depending on your use-case you need to carry out the following steps:

Use Case 1: Landing page is hosted by SAP

To migrate from the NEO environment to SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, you must unpublish your landing pages and then publish them again. You do this in the Content Studio app under Landing pages.  After unpublishing,  your landing page is redeployed on the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment.

 

 

Note that the URL of the landing page may change.

 

This depends on whether you use a Content Delivery Network (CDN) provider.

If you do not use your own CDN, the URL will change, and you must update the changed value in your web pages and email templates.

If you use your own CDN, the URL remains stable, however  you must adjust the mapping in the profile of your CDN provider. You can find the URL to which you need to map in the Content Repository Configuration app.

 

Use Case 2: Landing page/form is hosted by you

The downloaded form is hosted by you but you are sending the data to the SAP’s Cloud data buffer as described in Adjusting the JavaScript File.

Please adjust the Base Path parameter according to the latest version of this document.

 

Related Information

Please also see the following blog post Migration of the Simple Content Repository from Neo to the Cloud Foundry platform 

 

What to do in case of issues? 

Please create a ticket on the component CEC-MKT-LPC

I hope you can benefit from the information presented in this blog post. In case of questions or feedback, please feel free to comment on this blog.

entry.title: Re: Issue in SAP B1: add-on disabled, blocking invoice se...
entry.content:
Hi Perla_HernandezPea

It looks like an issue with the add-on setup for the users.

"From the Specify Setup Mode tab, select the default startup mode of this extension, specify the user
preferences, and choose Next.

  • Default Startup Mode: The default startup mode determines how the extension is launched for all users
    that are connected to the company.
  • Automatic - SAP Business One starts the extension automatically. Users can stop automatically
    started add-ons with no impact on SAP Business One. A warning message informs users when the
    extension stops.
  • Manual - SAP Business One does not start the extension automatically. Users can start the extension
    at any time. A message informs users when a manually started extension is stopped.
  • Mandatory - SAP Business One starts the extension automatically. The extension is necessary for the
    successful operation of the SAP Business One application. The application launches the extension at
    start-up and shuts it down if the extension is terminated for any reason. Users cannot start or stop
    mandatory extensions.
  • Disabled - The extension is disabled.

still having issue , create support ticket using component "SBO-EXT-MNG"

Kind Regards
Nidhi 
SAP Support

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA does not support automatic split purchase order by WBS code / storage location
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023  in a company that operates under a centralized purchasing model.

In SAP Business One, when creating a Purchase Order, if the items belong to different warehouses, the system automatically splits the PO into multiple purchase orders (one per warehouse). This is very useful for companies with centralized procurement but distributed warehouses/divisions, as it simplifies receiving and accounting at the warehouse level.

In SAP S/4HANA, I have observed that this functionality is not available by default. Instead, the system allows one PO to contain items for multiple plants/warehouses, and the logistics are handled separately.

👉 My questions are:

  1. Is there a standard option/configuration in S/4HANA to achieve automatic PO split by warehouse/plant (similar to SAP Business One)?

  2. If not standard, what is the recommended best practice for centralized purchasing with bulk discounts and later distribution to different warehouses/divisions?

  3. Is the solution to use Stock Transport Orders (STO) or Central Procurement Hub after creating one bulk PO at the head office?

  4. Has anyone implemented a custom BAdI enhancement (e.g., ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST) to mimic this B1 functionality in S/4HANA?

This is a critical requirement for us since our business negotiates bulk discounts with suppliers and then distributes materials to multiple warehouses.

Any guidance, best practices, or experience sharing will be highly appreciated.

Thanks & Regards,

silambarasan RS

entry.title: Taking and storing snapshots within Datasphere itself
entry.content:
Is there a way to take and store a snapshot of a view within Datasphere?

We have a remote source system upon which we cannot implement real-time replication. We therefore have a schedule to refresh the data periodically.

We then have a series of complex SQL views built on top that produce the models.

We have a requirement to provide a snapshot of the data at 6am each day, which can then be compared to the "live" version on-demand, within the same SAC dashboard.

Is there a way to create an extract from the fact view and store it in a local table based on a task, or another suitable option?
I have searched and came across the following passing comment on learning.sap.com:
"Views transform the data at the moment they are read without storing the result (although storing the view result as a snapshot is possible)", but it doesn't explain how.

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA does not support automatic split purchase...
entry.content: Yes in S/4HANA, the expected option is not available. This behavior is by design, as S/4HANA assumes centralized PO management with decentralized logistics handled via delivery and goods receipt processes. If this auto-split is critical for your operations, explore custom enhancement via BAdI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST

entry.title: 🟢 Evolving data integration with SQL services and CDS external entities
entry.content:
In this session, we’ll present the latest advancements in ABAP Cloud data integration. On the data exposure side, we’ll cover ABAP-managed database procedures for advanced read scenarios and extensions of SQL services to enable data loading scenarios for SQL clients, using CDS writable view entities. On the consumption side, we’ll explore write scenarios, and the use of static CDS external entities for seamless integration of external data into a CDS view stack.

Speakers : Leon Stern and Yannick Rath

entry.title: How to make YCOA and FPA1 available in SAC when integrating with S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
entry.content:
Hi all!

We are implementing SAP Analytics Cloud , integrated with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition , using the Rapid FP&A content.

According to the configuration guide 2JV_S4CLD2508_BB_ConfigGuide_EN_XX, slides 26–35, the default Chart of Accounts (YCOA) and Financial Statement Version (FPA1) should be available in S/4HANA and used in SAC. However, when setting up the SAC import connection, these do not appear as selectable options in the G/L Account dimension import jobs.
  • How can I verify in S/4HANA Cloud that YCOA and FPA1 are correctly activated and configured so they become available for selection in SAC?
    • Where in S/4HANA can I check that YCOA is the active Chart of Accounts
    • How can I confirm that FPA1 is available and properly structured as a Financial Statement Version?

Appreciate any guidance or examples from your implementation!

entry.title: Re: The Unofficial SAP Community HTML Tags Documentation
entry.content:
This is a Claude artifact that can help convert Markdown to HTML compliant with the SAP Community HTML tags. It is not perfect, there are trailing p tags without the opening p tag, but it should work if you hit save twice :-).

https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/209a363e-c69e-4b63-8cbc-1d687f04ec1a
